intro: Cheirolepis longispina, commonly known as the long-spined cheirolepis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
